meanings.definition: Side by side and having the same distance continuously between them.
meanings.sent1: The two roads are parallel, running next to each other.
meanings.sent2: The train tracks are parallel and never meet.
meanings.sent3: The parallel lines on the paper made the teacher smile.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts ran parallel to mine, never intersecting.
meanings.sent5: The parallel rows of trees created a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.definition: Occurring or existing at the same time or in a similar way.
meanings.sent1: Their birthdays are parallel, both falling in December.
meanings.sent2: Their interests are parallel, often leading to similar choices.
meanings.sent3: The parallel schedules of the twins made planning easy.
meanings.sent4: Their lives ran parallel, facing similar challenges.
meanings.sent5: The parallel paths of their careers brought them together.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is similar or analogous to another.
meanings.sent1: She is considered his parallel in the business world.
meanings.sent2: The novel's characters have parallels in real life.
meanings.sent3: The parallel between the two paintings was striking.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them was a parallel to a beautiful symphony.
meanings.sent5: The mentor found a parallel in his protege, a mirror image of his younger self.
